Name: Elephant
Fact: Elephants are the only animal that cannot jump.

Name: Kangaroo
Fact: Kangaroos can only jump forward, can't jump backwards.

Name: Blue Whale
Fact: Blue Whale is the largest animal in the world and can have a length of up to 30 meters.

Name: Giraffe
Fact: The giraffe has a 45-50 cm long tongue to reach tall leaves.

Name: Cat
Fact: Cats sleep an average of 13-16 hours per day.

Name: Koala
Fact: Koala sleeps up to 18-22 hours a day.

Name: Cheetah
Fact: Cheetah is the fastest land animal and can run up to 112 km/hour.

Name: Butterfly
Fact: Butterflies have a sensor taste on their feet.

Name: Dolphin
Fact: Dolphins sleep with one eye open to keep from predators.

Name: Owl
Fact: Owls cannot move their eyes so they turn their heads.

Name: Dog
Fact: Dogs have a sense of smell 40 times sharper than humans.

Name: Camel
Fact: Camels can drink up to 40 gallons of water in one drink.

Name: Hippopotamus
Fact: Nile horses sweat red to protect her skin from the sun.

Name: Penguin
Fact: Emperor's penguin is the only penguin that can survive in Antarctica throughout the year.

Name: Lion
Fact: The female lion is responsible for most of the hunting in their group.

Name: Turtle
Fact: Turtles can live more than 150 years and migrate thousands of kilometers.

Name: Ostrich
Fact: Ostrich has the biggest eyes of all land animals.

Name: Horse
Fact: The horse sleeps while standing to guard himself from predators.

Name: Bat
Fact: Bats are the only mammals that can fly.

Name: Gorilla
Fact: Gorillas have 98% DNA similar to humans.

Name: Duck
Fact: The sound of ducks did not echo, and the reason was still a mystery.

Name: Polar Bear
Fact: Polar bears have black skin under their white feathers to absorb the sun's heat.

Name: Wolf
Fact: Wolves live in groups called herds and have a strict social hierarchy.

Name: Bee
Fact: Honey bees are the only insects that produce food that can be eaten by humans.

Name: Clown Fish
Fact: Clown fish can change their sex to maintain population balance.

Name: Snake
Fact: Snakes do not have eyelids, so they can't blink.

Name: Pelican
Fact: Pelican has a large bag under its beak used to filter fish from water.

Name: Hedgehog
Fact: Hedgehogs have sharp thorns in his body which is used as a defense mechanism.

Name: Earthworm
Fact: Earthworms do not have eyes or lungs, they breathe through the skin.

Name: Electric Eel
Fact: Electric eels can produce up to 600 volts to defend themselves and hunt for prey.

Name: Tiger
Fact: Every tiger has a unique line pattern, such as fingerprints in humans.

Name: Bull
Fact: Bull did not see the red color, they were actually color blind.

Name: Shark
Fact: Some shark species can detect blood drops in water to a distance of half miles.

Name: Dove
Fact: Pigeons have extraordinary navigation capabilities and can return to their nests from very far places.

Name: Flamingo
Fact: Flamingo stands on one leg to save his body heat.

Name: Fox
Fact: Foxes can listen to the sound of mice moving under the snow.

Name: Frog
Fact: Some frogs can absorb water through their skin.

Name: Whale Shark
Fact: Whale sharks are the largest fish in the world, but only eat plankton.

Name: Beetle
Fact: Beetles are animals with the largest number of species in the world.

Name: Stingray
Fact: Stingrays have cartilage, not hard bones like fish in general.

Name: Orca
Fact: The killer or Orca whale is the biggest member of the dolphin family.

Name: Anaconda
Fact: Green Anaconda is the toughest snake in the world, can reach more than 250 kg.

Name: Arowana
Fact: Arowana is known as a dragon fish because of its long body shape and sparkling scales.

Name: Red Kangaroo
Fact: Red kangaroos can jump 8 meters in one jump.

Name: Parrot
Fact: Parrots can imitate human voices and other voices.

Name: Koi
Fact: Koi fish can live more than 200 years in certain conditions.

Name: Chicken
Fact: Chicken can recognize more than 100 other chicken faces.

Name: Chimpanzee
Fact: Chimpanzees use tools such as branches to get food from places that are difficult to reach.

Name: Pig
Fact: Pigs are animals that are very smart and can be trained to play simple video games.
